00001 /**
00002  * \file ExponentialDistribution.hpp
00003  * \brief Header for ExponentialDistribution
00004  *
00005  * Sample from an exponential distribution.
00006  *
00007  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2006-2011) <charles@karney.com> and licensed
00008  * under the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00009  * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00010  **********************************************************************/
00011 
00012 #if !defined(RANDOMLIB_EXPONENTIALDISTRIBUTION_HPP)
00013 #define RANDOMLIB_EXPONENTIALDISTRIBUTION_HPP \
00014   "$Id: edaaba7d83857755ff4a0b6940a90f53ba905ed5 $"
00015 
00016 #include <cmath>
00017 
00018 namespace RandomLib {
00019   /**
00020    * \brief The exponential distribution.
00021    *
00022    * Sample from the distribution exp(-\e x) for \e x >= 0.  This uses the
00023    * logarithm method, see Knuth, TAOCP, Vol 2, Sec 3.4.1.D.  Example
00024    * \code
00025    *   #include <RandomLib/ExponentialDistribution.hpp>
00026    *
00027    *   RandomLib::Random r;
00028    *   std::cout << "Seed set to " << r.SeedString() << "\n";
00029    *   RandomLib::ExponentialDistribution<double> expdist;
00030    *   std::cout << "Select from exponential distribution:";
00031    *   for (size_t i = 0; i < 10; ++i)
00032    *       std::cout << " " << expdist(r);
00033    *   std::cout << "\n";
00034    * \endcode
00035    *
00036    * @tparam RealType the real type of the results (default double).
00037    **********************************************************************/
00038   template<typename RealType = double> class ExponentialDistribution {
00039   public:
00040     /**
00041      * The type returned by ExponentialDistribution::operator()(Random&)
00042      **********************************************************************/
00043     typedef RealType result_type;
00044     /**
00045      * Return a sample of type RealType from the exponential distribution and
00046      * mean \e mu.  This uses Random::FloatU() which avoids taking log(0) and
00047      * allows rare large values to be returned.  If \e mu = 1, minimum returned
00048      * value = 0 with prob 1/2<sup><i>p</i></sup>; maximum returned value =
00049      * log(2)(\e p + \e e) with prob 1/2<sup><i>p</i> + <i>e</i></sup>.  Here
00050      * \e p is the precision of real type RealType and \e e is the exponent
00051      * range.
00052      *
00053      * @tparam Random the type of RandomCanonical generator.
00054      * @param[in,out] r the RandomCanonical generator.
00055      * @param[in] mu the mean value of the exponential distribution (default 1).
00056      * @return the random sample.
00057      **********************************************************************/
00058     template<class Random>
00059     RealType operator()(Random& r, RealType mu = RealType(1)) const throw();
00060   };
00061 
00062   template<typename RealType>  template<class Random> inline RealType
00063   ExponentialDistribution<RealType>::operator()(Random& r, RealType mu) const
00064     throw() {
00065     return -mu * std::log(r.template FloatU<RealType>());
00066   }
00067 } // namespace RandomLib
00068 
00069 #endif // RANDOMLIB_EXPONENTIALDISTRIBUTION_HPP
